list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: melancholic music of black American folk origin, typically in a twelve-bar sequence. It developed in the rural southern US toward the end of the 19th century, finding a wider audience in the 1940s, as black people migrated to the cities. This urban blues gave rise to rhythm and blues and rock and roll.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: blues has always had a strong following in Australia
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Blues luôn có một người theo dõi mạnh mẽ ở Úc

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: feelings of melancholy, sadness, or depression.
